intro: Sarcodiscus chloranthiformis, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the family Loranthaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. The plant relies on a variety of host trees for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found growing on the branches of other plants in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on parasitic plant ecology and host-plant interactions.
